column4: does debconf handle changes in /etc/nsswitch.conf? I cannot find any settings for it. So far I'm editting the file by hand.
I think thats the only way to configure it is by hand.
there is a man page for it.
the probblem isn't configuring the file. the problem is I want to preseed answers for an automated install that uses ldap.
you migh have to do some reading on that.
I'd rather not build a custom package to configure one file. I've done that already. :P
well its genereated by somethihng.  Just ahve to figure out what.
yeah. you're right. gotta be something.
but accorfding to the man page its part of libc5
looks like the package base-files creates it.
I still cant figure out how it's created though.
the weird thing is, ldap-auth-config is useless if you can't change nsswitch.conf with it.
